subject: RE: [junit] ClassCastException with JAXB object
msgSnippet: urban0_0legend, I do not think that this is JUnit related.  I would try to isolate the problem.  I have no experience with JTest, but my first guess would be
messageBody:
urban0_0legend,



I do not think that this is JUnit related. I would try to isolate the
problem. I have no experience with JTest, but my first guess would be
to look for problems with different jar file versions on the path of
Parasoft JTest. Have a close look at the classpath while running the
tests. If possible I would try to run the tests outside of JTest.



Andreas





________________________________

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
urban0_0legend
Sent: Thursday, June 29, 2006 6:30 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] ClassCastException with JAXB object



When running JUnit, this code:

JAXBContext context = JAXBContext.newInstance
("com.td.ds.coreAccount.utility.xml");
Unmarshaller unMarshaller = context.createUnmarshaller();
BusinessTypes busTypes = (BusinessTypes) unMarshaller.unmarshal
(input);

will generate a ClassCastException, but only when running through JUnit
test cases. Any ideas why this would be hapenning? I am running JUnit
3.8.1 using Parasoft JTest 6.0.

Thanks very much!
